processes.name: Multi-Period-Market

javascriptCode.code:
/* Loop Code. This goes at the Code of the Procedure Loop Object */

let candle = record.current // Our main dependencies are candles 
variable.last1400.push(candle.close) // Add the current close value to the last 1400 array.

if (variable.last1400.length > 1400) {
    variable.last1400.splice(0, 1) // Remove the first element of the array to keep it at a maximun of 1400 elements.
}

variable.sma7 = calculateSMA(7)
variable.sma14 = calculateSMA(14)
variable.sma21 = calculateSMA(21)
variable.sma28 = calculateSMA(28)
variable.sma35 = calculateSMA(35)
variable.sma70 = calculateSMA(70)
variable.sma140 = calculateSMA(140)
variable.sma210 = calculateSMA(210)
variable.sma280 = calculateSMA(280)
variable.sma350 = calculateSMA(350)
variable.sma700 = calculateSMA(700)
variable.sma1400 = calculateSMA(1400)

function calculateSMA(periods) {  // Having a function avoids us to repeat code.
    /* We check we have enough values to make the calculation */
    if (variable.last1400.length < periods) { return 0 } // If we dont, we define the value is zero.

    let sum = 0 // Initialize sum variable. 
    for (let i = variable.last1400.length - periods; i < variable.last1400.length; i++) { // Iterate through the last periods
        sum = sum + variable.last1400[i]
        /*
        if (index > 18 && index < 22) { // You can debug what is going on by console logging whatever you need. 
            console.log("index=" + index + "   i=" + i + "   variable.last1400.length=" + variable.last1400.length + "   periods=" + periods + "   sum=" + sum + "    sum/periods=" + (sum / periods) + "    currentValue=" + (variable.last1400[i]))
        }
        */
    }
    let sma = sum / periods
    return sma
}

function calculateSMA(periods) {  // Having a function avoids us to repeat code.
    /* We check we have enough values to make the calculation */
    if (variable.last1200.length < periods) { return 0 } // If we dont, we define the value is zero.

variable.last1500.push(candle.close) // Add the current close value to the last 1500 array.

variable.sma900 = calculateSMA(900)
variable.sma1200 = calculateSMA(1200)
variable.sma1500 = calculateSMA(1500)

function calculateSMA(periods) {  // Having a function avoids us to repeat code.
    /* We check we have enough values to make the calculation */
    if (variable.last1500.length < periods) { return 0 } // If we dont, we define the value is zero.

    let sum = 0 // Initialize sum variable. 
    for (let i = variable.last1500.length - periods; i < variable.last1500.length; i++) { // Iterate through the last periods
        sum = sum + variable.last1500[i]
        /*
        if (index > 18 && index < 22) { // You can debug what is going on by console logging whatever you need. 
            console.log("index=" + index + "   i=" + i + "   variable.last1500.length=" + variable.last1500.length + "   periods=" + periods + "   sum=" + sum + "    sum/periods=" + (sum / periods) + "    currentValue=" + (variable.last1500[i]))
        }
        */
    }
    let sma = sum / periods
    return sma
}

/* Initialization Code*/

variable.previousEMA20 = 0
variable.previousEMA50 = 0
variable.previousEMA100 = 0
variable.previousEMA200 = 0

/* Loop Code */

let candle = record.current 

variable.ema5 = calculateEMA(5, candle.close, variable.previousEMA5)
variable.previousEMA5 = variable.ema5

variable.ema10 = calculateEMA(10, candle.close, variable.previousEMA10)
variable.previousEMA10 = variable.ema10

variable.ema15 = calculateEMA(15, candle.close, variable.previousEMA15)
variable.previousEMA15 = variable.ema15

variable.ema20 = calculateEMA(20, candle.close, variable.previousEMA20)

variable.ema250 = calculateEMA(250, candle.close, variable.previousEMA250)
variable.previousEMA250 = variable.ema250

variable.ema500 = calculateEMA(500, candle.close, variable.previousEMA500)
variable.previousEMA500 = variable.ema500

variable.ema1000 = calculateEMA(1000, candle.close, variable.previousEMA1000)
variable.previousEMA1000 = variable.ema1000

function calculateEMA(periods, price, previousEMA) {
    let k = 2 / (periods + 1)
    return price * k + previousEMA * (1-k)
}

/* Initialization Code*/

variable.previousEMA10 = 0
